page.title: 04Employment in the village
page.content: Employment in the village has changed over the since the Second World War. In 1945 the main employment was working in the{foundry}and{coal {mining.}In 1955 it was working in the{ {colliery}and{farming.}In 1965 it was {coal mining}and{agriculture.}And in 1975 the main employment was again working in the{foundry. } We carried out a survey in our class to see which were the most common jobs for parents. We found out that factory work was most common for men and women. The second most common work for men was motor mechanic, while for women it was teaching. The unemployment rate among men was about 15%.
